forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. South southwest wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 54, with temperatures rising to around 57 overnight. South southwest wind 8 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
As evening drapes its soft, gray veil over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a palpable heaviness, hinting at the rain that is soon to arrive. Cloud cover looms thick, shrouding even the most iconic landmarks, while a gentle yet persistent wind stirs, whispering secrets of the dampness to come. The temperature hovers uncomfortably cool, nudging the residents towards layers of warmth and familiarity. Those venturing outside will find little solace in the chill; a cozy sweater or a stylish rain jacket would serve well against the impending storm.

As nightfall deepens, the promised rain begins to intensify, falling steadily from the murky heavens. The city, usually sparkling with vibrant lights against the twilight, takes on a muted tranquility, softened by the layering mist that lingers just beyond reach. For the contemplative soul, this is an evening best spent indoors. Consider a leisurely stroll through your favorite nearby café, where the scent of freshly brewed coffee mingles with the rain-soaked air, or luxuriate in the warmth of your living room with a good book. The weather beckons not for grand adventures but for moments of quiet reflection amidst the patter of raindrops.
